definition: A systemic autoimmune disease primarily affecting joints, characterized by the accumulation of Ama (toxins) and vitiation of Vata dosha.
symptoms: Joint pain (Sandhi Shula), Swelling (Sandhi Shotha), Morning stiffness (Stambha), Fever (Jwara), Body ache (Angamarda)

definition: A chronic inflammatory disorder that can affect more than just your joints. In some people, the condition can damage a wide variety of body systems, including the skin, eyes, lungs, heart and blood vessels.
symptoms: Tender, warm, swollen joints; Joint stiffness that is usually worse in the mornings and after inactivity; Fatigue, fever and loss of appetite

definition: A painful condition characterized by radiating pain starting from the lower back (Kati) and moving down to the leg (Pada). It is caused by the aggravation of Vata dosha.
symptoms: Sharp pain from lower back to leg (Ruja), Numbness (Stambha), Tingling (Toda), Difficulty in walking

definition: Pain affecting the back, hip, and outer side of the leg, caused by compression of a spinal nerve root in the lower back, often owing to degeneration of an intervertebral disk.
symptoms: Pain that radiates from your lower (lumbar) spine to your buttock and down the back of your leg is the hallmark of sciatica.

definition: A severe, unilateral (one-sided), throbbing headache, often associated with nausea and sensitivity to light and sound. Correlated with migraine.
symptoms: Unilateral headache (Ardha Shirahshula), Throbbing pain (Toda), Photophobia (Prakasha Asahishnuta), Nausea (Hrillasa)

definition: A primary headache disorder characterized by recurrent headaches that are moderate to severe. Typically, episodes affect one half of the head, are pulsating in nature, and last from a few hours to three days.
symptoms: Severe, throbbing headache, usually on one side; Nausea and vomiting; Extreme sensitivity to light and sound

definition: A disorder of the digestive system, particularly the small intestine (Grahani), leading to impaired digestion and absorption. Often correlated with Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS).
symptoms: Altered bowel habits (Muhurbaddha/Muhurdrava Mala), Abdominal pain (Udara Shula), Bloating (Adhmana), Undigested food in stool

definition: A common disorder that affects the large intestine. Signs and symptoms include cramping, abdominal pain, bloating, gas, and diarrhea or constipation, or both.
symptoms: Abdominal pain or cramping, a bloated feeling, gas, diarrhea or constipation

definition: A type of bronchial asthma characterized by paroxysmal attacks of breathlessness, wheezing, and coughing, especially at night or in the early morning.
symptoms: Difficulty in breathing (Shwasa Krichrata), Wheezing sound (Ghurgharaka), Cough (Kasa), Restlessness

definition: A condition in which a person's airways become inflamed, narrow and swell, and produce extra mucus, which makes it difficult to breathe.
symptoms: Shortness of breath, chest tightness or pain, wheezing when exhaling, trouble sleeping caused by shortness of breath

definition: A skin disease characterized by itching (Kandu), vesicles (Pidaka), discharge (Srava), and discoloration. Correlated with Eczema or Atopic Dermatitis.
symptoms: Intense itching, Dry and scaly patches (Rajyo), Oozing vesicles (Srava), Skin discoloration (Vaivarnya)

definition: A condition that causes dry, itchy and inflamed skin. It's common in young children but can occur at any age.
symptoms: Dry skin, itching, which may be severe, especially at night, red to brownish-gray patches

definition: A general term for diseases of the heart (Hridaya). Often used for conditions involving chest pain, like angina.
symptoms: Chest pain or discomfort (Ruja), Palpitations (Hrid-drava), Dyspnea (Shwasa), Fatigue (Klama)

definition: A type of chest pain caused by reduced blood flow to the heart muscles. It's not usually life-threatening, but it's a warning sign that you could be at risk of a heart attack or stroke.
symptoms: Chest pain that may be described as pressure, squeezing, burning or tightness

definition: A neurological disorder caused by Vata aggravation, characterized by tremors (Kampa), rigidity (Stambha), and slow movements. Correlated with Parkinson's disease.
symptoms: Tremors (Kampa), Stiffness (Stambha), Slowness of movement (Cheshta Sanga), Postural instability

definition: A progressive disorder that affects the nervous system and the parts of the body controlled by the nerves. Symptoms start slowly. The first symptom may be a barely noticeable tremor in just one hand.
symptoms: Tremor, slowed movement (bradykinesia), rigid muscles, impaired posture and balance

definition: A metabolic disorder characterized by excessive and turbid urination. Madhumeha, a subtype, is directly correlated with Diabetes Mellitus.
symptoms: Excessive urination (Prabhuta Mutrata), Turbid urine (Avila Mutrata), Sweet taste in mouth (Madhurasya), Fatigue

definition: A chronic condition that affects the way the body processes blood sugar (glucose). With type 2 diabetes, the body either doesn't produce enough insulin, or it resists insulin.
symptoms: Increased thirst, frequent urination, increased hunger, unintended weight loss, fatigue

definition: A digestive disorder characterized by indigestion and a burning sensation in the chest and throat, caused by an increase of acidic and hot qualities. Correlated with Acid Peptic Disorder/GERD.
symptoms: Burning sensation in chest and throat (Hrit-Kantha Daha), Sour belching (Amlodgara), Indigestion (Avipaka), Nausea

definition: A digestive disease in which stomach acid or bile irritates the food pipe lining. This is a chronic disease that occurs when stomach acid or, occasionally, stomach content, flows back into your food pipe (esophagus).
symptoms: A burning sensation in your chest (heartburn), usually after eating, which might be worse at night, chest pain, difficulty swallowing
